results.title: Composer Magoo
results.creator_credit: UPA Pictures, Glan Heisch, Henry G. Saperstein, Peter De Met and Grants Simmons
results.brief_description: Mr Magoo attempts to lodge the new song he has just written with the US Copyright Office. He ends up at a talent tryout by mistake where an Elvis look-alike becomes consumed by jealousy after hearing Magoo’s song.
results.creator_credit_for_label: UPA Pictures, Glan Heisch, Henry G. Saperstein, Peter De Met and Grants Simmons

results.title: Complex waves: propagation evanescence and stability (TEFC)
results.brief_description: James Mecher at Massachusetts Institute of Technology uses springs to demonstrate the waves equation and then develops this concept to show how it relates to the study of electromagnetic fields and forces as they interact with moving and deformable media.
results.description: James Mecher at Massachusetts Institute of Technology uses springs to demonstrate the waves equation and then develops this concept to show how it relates to the study of electromagnetic fields and forces as they interact with moving and deformable media.

results.title: Compilation: one hundred entertainments
results.brief_description: One hundred entertainments: Follows an acrobatic troupe in Shensi Province as they perform and talk about their lives. “Son of the ocean”: A film crew travels on a boat on the Yangtze and talks to some of the passengers.

results.title: Compilation: not so much a desert more a way of life
results.brief_description: Not so much a desert more a way of life: Much of Australia is described as desert, but wherever he looks, David Bellamy finds life among the sand and rocks. “The Great barriers” (prod. Mike Weatherley): Australia’s coasts are battleground’s where seaweeds, coral and mangroves fight for survival against the ravages of the ocean.

results.title: Compilation: il bruco the apple worm
results.brief_description: Three animated films by Bruno Bozzetto. “The Apple worm”: A humorous look at the troubles of an apple worm. “The Swimming pool”: A man who looks forward to using his new swimming pool is thwarted at every turn. “Self service”: A satirical cartoon about a group of enterprising mosquitoes.

results.title: Compilation: big brown beastie big brown face
results.brief_description: Big brown beastie, big brown face (Aust., prod., dir. Robert Talbot): Film about Bill Roycroft, world famous Australian horseman. “Ponies of Miklaengi” (U.S., prod. Daniel Smith ; dir. Gary Templeton): Two youngsters on horses round up sheep in Iceland. “So you want to own a pony” (Sydney, prod., dir. Robert Talbot): Explains the role of the Pony Club in helping owners with their first pony.

results.title: Compilation: anyway what is an Australian?
results.brief_description: Anyway…what is an Australian? (Melb., dir. Barbara Boyd; exec. prod. Ross Campbell): Views the concept of multiculturalism through the eyes of several new Australians in Melbourne. “Arrivederci Roma” (Melb., dir. Geoffrey Wright; prod. Richard Zatorski): A new Australian student comes to grips with his first swimming lesson. “Minh: a Vietnamese” (Sydney): A look at the life of a Vietnamese refugee in Australia.

results.title: Compilation: animal movie
results.brief_description: Animal movie (Canada): An animated film to help children understand how animals move. “Martin the cobbler” (U.S.): A clay animated film about a Russian shoemaker who discovers new meanings in life by meditating on old truths. “Model railroading unlimited” (U.S.): A young man’s absorption in model railroading serves as the source of comedy.

results.title: Compilation Ultimate skills
results.brief_description: Ultimate skills (Australia): Three motorcycle champions explain and demonstrate their skills at trail riding, motocross and road riding. 2.” Survival of the fastest” (U.K.): Shows the evolution of the motorcycle from a primitive machine into a glamorous, sophisticated piece of engineering. Looks at research and development and compares British and Japanese bikes.

results.title: Compilation The Angel and the rat
results.brief_description: The Angel and the rat (Melbourne, dir. Steve McDonald): Examines the ideas and lifestyle of Smiley Williams, a young sculptor. “Heart, head and hand” (dir. Peter Weir): Scenes from the life and work of Australian potter, Peter Rushforth. “Natural glass” (N.Z. dir. John King ; prod. Derek Wright); Looks at a one-man revival of natural glassmaking in New Zealand.
